metadata.synopsis: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:ARRIVE WITH GREYMON1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -4.60, 0.21, -208.224. Cinematic starts > choose attack him5. killcombat6. Click on raft7. Wait for cinematic to start 8. roll amazing9. Choose the 1st roll and pass it (Greymon will follow you)ARRIVE WITHOUT GREYMON1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -4.60, 0.21, -208.224. Cinematic starts > choose attack him5. killcombat6. Click on raft7. roll terrible8. killcombat9. Click on rudder > choose to continue

133.speaker: Corsair Greymon
133.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

39.speaker: Morghal
39.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

1.speaker: Corsair Greymon
1.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

111.speaker: Morghal
111.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

44.speaker: Corsair Greymon
44.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

112.speaker: Morghal
112.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

83.speaker: Morghal
83.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

123.speaker: Lae'zel
123.text: I am Lae'zel - daughter of Gith, defender of Vlaakith. And I am no slave.

33.speaker: Morghal
33.text: Ooh - that one's feisty. Thrinn's gonna knock the snot right out of her.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I am a True Soul. And you will treat me with respect.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I'm here to see the sergeant. I have her boots.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I was told to report to the sergeant.

38.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
38.text: Deep gnomes, mostly. Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: It's a problem, all right. I'm a True Soul, and you will treat me like one.

20.speaker: Morghal
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

108.speaker: Corsair Greymon
108.text: Aye, they speak true. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I'm not here to work. I'm here for the sergeant.

11.speaker: Corsair Greymon
11.text: Aye. They sniffed up Gekh's corpse. Found the hoon sailing his skiff.

60.speaker: Morghal
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

150.speaker: Corsair Greymon
150.text: Aye. One of those Absolute crackpots. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I don't care about slaves. Now if you'll excuse me.

5.speaker: Morghal
5.text: Hold up, jargh. You ain't goin'... nngh...
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.NodeContext: Jargh = Fool. ZHARG.

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *You feel the slightest of stirrings in your head. The duergar is not infected, yet your minds resonate.*
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: No mind-meld, just a slight head-touch for the player and Morghal.

79.speaker: Morghal
79.text: I'll be - you ain't shittin'. Felt the tingle.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal start with her right hand touching her head. This is the end of the discomfort from the pain

55.speaker: Morghal
55.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want through? Make a donation. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal grins evilly and brandishes a blade

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I don't have that kind of gold on me.

0.speaker: Morghal
0.text: Well, shit. Good thing I was just takin' the piss.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

152.speaker: Lae'zel
152.text: I am keen to sever Nere's head. A shame we must do the favour of freeing him first.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Seems we'll have to free Nere before we can collect the bounty on his head.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: Free the drow, take his head, get out of here in one piece. Easy as one, two, three.

134.speaker: Lae'zel
134.text: As for the gnome slaves, pay no heed. A bleeding heart is an unnecessary burden.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: Might be worth talking to some of the gnome slaves - before they're worked to death, that is.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: Don't forget the gnomes. I'm not leaving them with their captors.

122.speaker: Astarion
122.text: Let's do the job and get out of here. All this talk of slaves is just depressing.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: Not to mention - they keep gnomes as slaves. Though not for much longer, if I have a say.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: There's the matter of the gnomes, too. Wouldn't do to stand by and keep them enslaved.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: We have to free Nere before we can take his head? Sounds like a lot of wasted effort.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: We're closing in on Nere. But if we want his head, we'll need to free him first.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: So we must save the drow first, then sever his head after... Pleasantries like that make me quite homesick.

125.speaker: Morghal
125.text: But I'm warning you - that Twat-Soul ain't settle up soon, there'll be hell to pay for the lot of you cult-buggers.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: Come - and pay no heed to their slaves. A bleeding heart is an unnecessary burden.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: Charming - and slave drivers to boot. Might be worth talking to the gnomes before they're worked to death.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: I've seen nasty, but these guys are on their own level. I have a feeling this is gonna end badly.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: All the charm and wit you'd expect from a slaver. Even a slaver of gnomes.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Did I hear right - they keep gnomes as slaves? Not for much longer, if the Blade has a say.

135.speaker: Gale
135.text: She really oozes charm, this one. Perhaps we should spare a thought for the wretches she's enslaved.

143.speaker: Morghal
143.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and takes gold from player, then sheathes the blade

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I'm not giving you a single coin.

130.speaker: Morghal
130.text: Unclog your hole - just shitting around.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I'll take your head before you take my gold.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I'd rather cut my own throat than hand my coin to a bloody duergar.

51.speaker: Morghal
51.text: Shit. Would love to see that. Now unclog your dwarf-hole - I'm just bustin' your 'nads.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

37.speaker: Morghal
37.text: In that case, let's talk business. Your Twat-Soul friend Nere caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a hornet's arse.

9.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
9.text: Coupla gnome slaves stuck with him too, little bastards.

95.speaker: Morghal
95.text: You Absolute-shaggers owe us a crap-load of coin. You want through? Make a donation. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Did you say you keep slaves here?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Not a problem in the slightest.

87.speaker: Morghal
87.text: Good. Now cough up the coin - I got shit to do.

145.speaker: Morghal
145.text: Fine. Now pay the toll, jargh. I'm tired of your face.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I've got no use for slavers. Including you.

149.speaker: Morghal
149.text: You'll work through it, jargh. Now pay up - don't got all day.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Is that a threat? Because that is a problem.

77.speaker: Morghal
77.text: I don't make threats - I educate. Now hand over the coin and get moving.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: If there's a mark on those gnomes, it will be.

100.speaker: Morghal
100.text: Yeah, I bet you'll mess us up good, squeaker. Now pay up, or sod off.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I don't think you understand - I'm gutting you here and now.

114.speaker: Morghal
114.text: I'll be. You're one of them cult-freaks. Felt the tingle.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal start with her right hand touching her head. This is the end of the discomfort from the pain

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I've got no use for slavers. Including you.

92.speaker: Morghal
92.text: That right? And just what do... nngh...
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Is that a threat? Because that is a problem.

106.speaker: Morghal
106.text: Shit. Just 'cause you're duergar don't make you clan. What... nngh...
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: If there's a mark on those gnomes, it will be.

105.speaker: Morghal
105.text: Shit. You think a runt like you's gonna... nngh...
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Keep talking to me like that, and I'll clap you in irons myself.

61.speaker: Morghal
61.text: That what you think? Shit. The Weaver herself couldn't... nngh...
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'll just kill you, then. No problem at all.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: If you lust for blood, so be it - though scouting may be the wiser option.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: There could be scores of duergar here. Let's not pick a fight until we know how the odds are stacked.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: I'm ready to go, but maybe we should wait before provoking these pricks.

63.speaker: Morghal
63.text: I hear you right? You want a thrashing?

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I want you to try to give me one.

93.speaker: Morghal
93.text: I'll choke the life out of you, shit-for-brains.

156.speaker: Morghal
156.text: That's what I figured. I... nngh...
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: And I was worried we weren't on the same page. Let's spill their guts.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: I reckon this place is swarming with slavers. I hope you know what you're doing.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: Uhm - I think you might be about to bite off more duergar than you can chew.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: To bind another in slavery is abhorrent. As are you.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Don't worry about what I'm here for - I'll be on my way.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Disgusting. I assure you, we are not 'ploughing'.

17.speaker: Morghal
17.text: Pity for you. A good plough might dislodge that stick from your... nngh...
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

35.speaker: Morghal
35.text: Shit - you're as plucky as you are pretty. Sergeant might have two uses for you.

141.speaker: Corsair Greymon
141.text: Close your hatch, Morghal. They're one of those Absolute crackpots. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

158.speaker: Morghal
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I am Lae'zel - daughter of Gith, defender of Queen Vlaakith. And I am no slave.

90.speaker: Morghal
90.text: Well la-dee-damn-da. I'm empress of this dock, and when I say 'jump', you ask 'how high?'

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

91.speaker: Morghal
91.text: Ooh - this one's feisty. Thrinn's gonna knock the snot right out of him.

139.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
139.text: Weapon at ready, lass - company's calling.
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party arrives at shore on their boat. Line addressed to Morghal

62.speaker: Morghal
62.text: What do we got here? Dead hoon walking, seems like.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party disembarksNodeContext: Hoon = as spelled. An outsider.

25.speaker: Morghal
25.text: Got any reason I shouldn't sever your head and toss it to the rothé?

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: Let her try. My thirst for blood has yet to be quenched.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Let's try and keep this diplomatic. I'd rather not jump into another fight quite so soon.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Not in the mood for another fight, believe it or not. Can we play nice?

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Another belligerent dwarf? This is getting tiresome.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: I reckon diplomacy may be in order. The Blade could use a breather.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: Let's not get into another scrape, shall we? Still catching my breath after the last one.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Just let me through. I'm not looking for trouble.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I'll be severing yours if it's all the same.
